source_note: State baseline derived from Missouri Department of Natural Resources (DNR) Solid Waste Management Program and local recycling programs.

organics.guidance: Composting of yard and food waste allowed under DNR rules; home composting exempt from regulation.
organics.bin: Green waste bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Kansas City and St. Louis offer yard waste collection; food waste programs limited.
provenance: Missouri DNR Solid Waste Management Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes before placing in bins.
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue recycling bin or drop-off center.
paper_cardboard.notes: Greasy or waxed materials not accepted.

glass_containers.guidance: Glass bottles and jars accepted at drop-offs; rinse and remove lids.
glass_containers.notes: Not all curbside programs accept glass.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans; rinse clean.
metal_containers.notes: No large scrap metal or aerosol cans.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1â€“#2; local programs vary for other plastics.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags, film, and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: No statewide bottle deposit law in Missouri.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle with curbside or drop-off bin if accepted.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: No CRV program or refund system.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries via HHW programs or collection sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of household trash and recycling bins.

e_waste.guidance: Recycle electronics through the Missouri Electronics Recycling Program or local events.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, computers, and monitors; landfill disposal banned for covered devices.
provenance: Missouri Electronics Scrap Management Rule (10 CSR 25-19.010)

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film are not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to retail store collection bins.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Film creates contamination issues in MRFs.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste must be scheduled for pickup or dropped at transfer station or landfill.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and limits vary by city or hauler.
provenance: Kansas City bulky item pickup rules
